title: Door surfaces and edges free from micro-cracks/crazing
instruction: Inspect door inside and outside under bright light. Change viewing angle to catch reflections. Look for hairline cracks, spider-web patterns, whitening, clouding or stress marks.

title: Door alignment unchanged (square seating, even engagement)
instruction: Close door and visually confirm it seats evenly with no new gaps. Compare to normal appearance. Any change from usual fit = fail.

title: Door retaining/locking/guide system secure
instruction: Confirm rails/clamps/guides are present, correctly positioned, and not loose. Gently test for movement by hand (no tools).

title: Door sealing/contact faces clean and undamaged
instruction: Wipe contact/sealing surfaces. Check for cuts, nicks, dents, embedded debris, or uneven wear.

title: Door under-pressure gentle movement check
instruction: Inflate to a low pressure (per normal operation). Without force, gently test that the door cannot move or disengage. Stop immediately if any movement occurs.

title: Upload external photo of door closed (weekly evidence)
instruction: Take a clear photo of the door closed from outside showing the full perimeter/seat area.

title: Windows free from cracks/crazing/scratches/delamination
instruction: Inspect each window inside and outside using angled light. Look especially at corners/edges for stress marks or star cracking.

title: Window edges/perimeter intact (no lifting/gaps/creep)
instruction: Inspect the full perimeter where the window meets the vessel. Look for lifting, separation, gasket movement, edge creep, compression marks, or new gaps.

title: Distortion check (no abnormal bowing change)
instruction: Look through the window at a straight edge (door frame/wall line). If distortion looks worse than normal, note and report.

title: Upload photo of each window (weekly evidence)
instruction: Take clear photos of each window from outside. Ensure edges/perimeter are visible.

title: Shell exterior free from dents, bulges, deformation (hard-shell)
instruction: Walk around the vessel and visually inspect. Any new dent/bulge/deformation = fail and report.

title: Corrosion check (hard-shell)
instruction: Inspect around seams, welds, feet, under door area, and around penetrations for rust, pitting, blistering paint, or corrosion staining.

title: Frame level and stable (frame-supported models)
instruction: Confirm frame stands square, does not rock, and all fasteners/clips are intact.

title: No sharp edges or rubbing points contacting soft-shell fabric
instruction: Inspect all frame contact points. Confirm no sharp corners, burrs, or abrasion zones against TPU/fabric.

title: Penetrations secure (no movement at bulkheads/ports)
instruction: Visually inspect each penetration. Gently hand-check for looseness (no tools). Any movement = fail.

title: Hoses free from kinks, cracking, flattening, damage
instruction: Inspect full hose length. Look for splits, crushed sections, brittleness, or loose ends.

title: Clamps/fittings seated and correctly oriented
instruction: Confirm clamps are in place and fittings are fully seated. Any cross-threading, wobble, or missing clamp = fail.

title: Main inlet valve smooth operation
instruction: Cycle the valve slowly (open/close). Must not stick or grind.

title: Relief / dump valve unobstructed and unmodified
instruction: Confirm it is accessible, not taped, not capped, not altered, and outlet not blocked.

title: Gauge reads consistently (basic sanity check)
instruction: Inflate to normal pressure and observe gauge moves smoothly without jumping/sticking. When depressurised, returns to zero.

title: Pressure hold test (2–3 minutes at normal operating pressure)
instruction: Inflate to normal operating pressure. Observe gauge for at least 2–3 minutes. Pressure should remain stable. Any drift/instability = fail.

title: No abnormal sounds during pressurisation/hold/depressurisation
instruction: Listen near door/windows/ports during full cycle. Any new unusual noise = fail and report.

title: Zip track and teeth condition (full length)
instruction: Inspect full zip length. Look for missing teeth, misalignment, worn track, or separation.

title: Seams/welds intact (no peeling/delamination/bubbling)
instruction: Inspect all welded seams (especially near ports and high-stress corners). Look for lifting layers, bubbles, or edge peel.

title: Floor/foam condition and placement confirmed (XL Pro)
instruction: Confirm protective foam/base is intact and positioned exactly as required. If torn/missing/incorrect, do not operate.

title: Data plate & serial number present and legible
instruction: Confirm serial/ratings are readable and unchanged. If missing/illegible, report.

title: Safety signage present (No oils/No flames/Max pressure)
instruction: Confirm signage is present near the chamber and readable.

title: No oils/greases or contamination near oxygen/air components
instruction: Check around hoses, masks, fittings, and interior for oily residues or unapproved sprays/cleaners.

title: Weekly declaration accepted
instruction: Confirm checks completed truthfully and defects reported.
